material.mattext: What is the primary purpose of voice coding techniques?
To efficiently encode voice signals for transmission
To convert digital signals to analog
Which coding technique is used to reduce the bit rate required to transmit voice signals?
What is the basic principle behind pulse code modulation (PCM)?
Sampling the analog signal at regular intervals and quantizing the amplitude
Encoding the digital signal using frequency modulation
Compressing the voice signal to reduce bit rate
Modulating the amplitude of the signal
What does the term "bit rate" refer to in the context of voice coding?
The number of bits transmitted per second
The number of samples per second
The frequency of the carrier signal
Which coding technique uses variable-length codes to represent frequently occurring symbols?
What is the main advantage of using linear predictive coding (LPC) in voice communication?
Which voice coding technique models the human vocal tract to compress speech?
Which technique is used in adaptive differential pulse code modulation (ADPCM) to improve compression efficiency?
Adjusting the quantization step size based on signal changes
Using variable-length codes for frequently occurring symbols
Modulating the signal with a fixed frequency
What is the purpose of quantization in voice coding?
Mapping the amplitude of the signal to discrete levels
Which coding technique is known for its simplicity and low bit rate?
What is the primary disadvantage of delta modulation (DM)?
Which voice coding technique is used in GSM systems for efficient speech transmission?
What is the main advantage of using vector quantization in voice coding?
What is the purpose of the codebook in vector quantization?
To store a set of representative vectors for encoding
To convert digital signals to analog
Which coding technique uses a combination of predictive coding and transform coding to achieve high compression efficiency?
What is the role of the excitation signal in Code-Excited Linear Prediction (CELP)?
To represent the residual signal after linear prediction
Which coding technique is used in modern speech codecs like MP3 and AAC for high compression and quality?
What does the term "codec" stand for in digital voice communication?
Which component is responsible for converting digital voice signals back into analog form?
What is the primary advantage of using adaptive differential pulse code modulation (ADPCM) over standard PCM?
Which coding technique involves the prediction of the current sample based on previous samples to reduce redundancy?
What is the purpose of the linear predictor in Linear Predictive Coding (LPC)?
To estimate the current sample based on past samples
Which technique is used to remove redundant information from the voice signal to achieve compression?
What does the term "speech synthesis" refer to in the context of voice coding?
Which coding technique is typically used in low-bandwidth voice communication systems?
What is the main advantage of transform coding in voice communication?
High compression efficiency with good quality
Which term describes the process of converting a continuous range of values into a finite range of discrete values?
What is the primary function of a vocoder in voice coding?
To analyze and synthesize voice signals
Which voice coding technique is known for its ability to model the vocal tract and vocal cords?
What does the term "bit error rate" refer to in digital communication?
The number of samples per second
The range of frequencies available for transmitting data
The total number of bits transmitted
The rate at which errors occur in the transmitted bits
